Title: The future of Stack Overflow
Description: Stack Overflow, once the cornerstone developer communities, is fading away. What is the future of Stack Overflow considering its recent declining popularity?

Title: Please stop building scroll-driven websites
Description: Does it look cool? Yes. Is it distracting and annoying? Also yes.

Title: Why Claude Code feels different
Description:
Claude Code shows me an unusual ability across massive and complex codebases, while others struggle despite using the same base models.
I use many coding tools daily: Claude Code, Cursor, Jetbrains AI, Antigravity, Zed, and Warp. I won't go into detail about each one of the use cases, but across all of them, Claude Code is consistently better.

Title: Stored Procedures Considered Harmful
Description: Having used stored procedures extensively in the past year, I have come to the conclusion that they bring more pain than good in a modern .NET web application.

Title: Tiny TPU in a Week · Shri
Claude Code sessions should be encrypted
Description:
Claude Code is exploding in popularity right now, and people are using it for much more than writing code.
Everyone should be using Claude Code more
PMs, marketers, designers, founders, parents. Everyone.
The trick is to forget that it’s called Claude Code and instead think of it as Claude Local or Claude Agent. It’s essentially a super-intelligent AI running locally, able to do… pic.twitter.com/F6iDwYPMRY
— Lenny Rachitsky (@lennysan) October 14, 2025 Whether it’s to manage your email, write peer performance feedback, or even be your Chief of Staff—people are putting sensitive, personal information into Claude Code. And the more we use it for non-coding work, the more the session files are valuable and private1.

Title: 53 Times Flock Safety Hardcoded the Password for America's Surveillance Infrastructure
Description: A responsible disclosure documenting an organization-wide ArcGIS API key exposed across 53 public-facing assets, granting access to the mapping infrastructure underlying approximately 12,000 law enforcement, community, and private sector deployments.

Title: Avoiding TanStack Form Pitfalls
Description: While integrating TanStack Form with schema validation libraries like Zod, I ran into a subtle type system gap that caused validation errors to silently fail. Here's how I diagnosed the issue and built a type-safe wrapper to prevent it from happening again.
